original_title: One dead, three missing in waterfall tragedy
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The body of one young man who was reported missing after going for a swim in the Ella-Wala Falls in Wellawaya was recovered on Tuesday (21) evening.
However, three others who had gone with him for a swim remain missing.
A group of ten young men had visited the Eella-Wala falls on Tuesday (21) morning for a swim.
News 1st correspondents said that four of them were later reported missing.
Following a massive search carried out by the locals and Sri Lanka Police, the body of one person was recovered.
Search and rescue operations continued until late evening on Tuesday (21) to locate the three other missing men.
Several individuals who had visited this location had drowned earlier, and the most recent incident was reported in February 2022 when three lives were lost.
According to locals, around 15 people had died after drowning at the Ella-Wala falls.

The Ugandan parliament has approved a bill that would impose imprisonment on individuals who identify as gay
